text: <@U26DA9CQ0> I tried but this will not work. HubSpot gives this message :Groups containing flex columns, global groups, or non-upgraded modules cannot be made global.
Hmmm. Maybe you can remove the flex column, make it global, then after you make your local copy add it back in? <@UBZ8C6DTK>
<@U26DA9CQ0> You're good at playing with this. Hope that HubSpot can allow to clone elements or groups to other templates also.
That would be nice! I just use custom modules for everything at this point. It gives me more control and I just use repeaters instead of flex-columns.
Can we not do flexible columns in the blog templates?
We have a client who wants to be able to add items to the right sidebar on a per post basis
Good case for using HubDB
I’ve been handling pretty much all global content that way these days
yea but they bought a template so we need to use that
they dont have the budget to do a lot of HubDb work, or the know how lol
The giphy plugin here really shoots from the hip. The one on our slack at least asks you to confirm that it’s the gif you want.
lol yea its a check in the settings
we made sure to enable that on ours because at first we didnt have a rating on it
was pretty risky everytime
Yeah I’ve typed in some unassuming things and ended up with some body parts
i think my only option is a CM that will be a select field and show those modules on a needed basis
I’ve done something before, maybe in WP where I had a hidden page that contained some global content as a way to avoid widgets.
So maybe you could make a post with a flex column in it then pipe it into the blog listing sidebar?

Figured this out, by building a repeater with the select field that lists out X amount of modules, it would allow them to choose a module, then add however many they want on the sidebar and be able to limit it
Nice!

thats in the blog template right? 

I didn’t think it was possible to include other modules in Custom Modules <-- is that correct?
You should be able to include some of these <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags>
it would be using the tag not dragging the actual module in
When using the "CTA" field in the new DM, how do i get it to actually load that cta instead of just outputting the ID?
{% cta guid=“{{ module.hero_cta }}” %}
Yep thats what i was thinking
thanks <@U26DA9CQ0>
Welcome!
